A line began forming outside the Multnomah County building shortly after 5 a.m. Monday morning , as gay couples awaited the chance to get married , should a judge overturn Oregon 's ban on gay marriage .
By 10 a.m. , more than a dozen people milled about on the sidewalk outside , sitting in lawn chairs and chatting over a makeshift buffet of coffee and pastries .
Judge Michael McShane has said he will rule on the legal status of Oregon 's gay marriage ban at noon on Monday .
Judge Michael McShane has said he will rule on the legal status of Oregon 's gay marriage ban at noon on Monday .
It is likely he will overturn the ban , which voters enacted in 2004 , just months after Multnomah County began issuing marriage licenses to gay couples .

Deanna Geiger , 55 , and her partner , Janine Nelson , 53 , spurred the legal debate over gay marriage in Oregon in Octobe r , when they sued the county along with the state , arguing the statewide ban was unconstitutional .
